questions.question: He wants to know if he ……………………….. a promotion.
I remarked how lovely …………………………….
questions.description: In exclamations the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: If I had any money, I ……………………………. you a gift.
questions.description: In the second conditional we use a simple past in the if clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I don’t know how many books ……………………………. written.
questions.description: In reported questions the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: She seemed ………………………… about something.
questions.description: Seem is a copular verb. We use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: I spoke to a woman who …………………………. the chairperson.
questions.description: We use seem to be before noun phrases.

questions.question: When we were kids we …………………………….. hours watching TV.
questions.description: Would is used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: He ……………………….. be here soon. He left office at five.
questions.description: Should is used to talk about logical possibility.

questions.question: I ………………………. have called him in the morning, but I forgot.
questions.description: Should is used with a perfect infinitive to talk about past events that did not happen.
